author: @tahakhanworld

text:
Operation Sindoor is a decisive success for India. üáÆüá≥üî•

1Ô∏è‚É£ Satellite Evidence:
India released before-and-after satellite images showing the destruction of Pakistan‚Äôs airbases and military assets.
.Till today, Pakistan has failed to release even a single before-and-after satellite image of any Indian airbase.
. This proves India acted with truth and evidence, while Pakistan relied only on propaganda and empty words.

 Pakistan‚Äôs Double Standards:
In India, some groups tried to claim the operation was ‚Äúfor Pakistan‚Äôs domestic purpose.‚Äù
.Yet, at the same time, Pakistan‚Äôs government and army were repeatedly saying ‚ÄúThank You‚Äù to Donald Trump and the U.S.
. If India‚Äôs operation was just propaganda, why was Pakistan thanking Trump again and again? Clearly, Pakistan knows its security has collapsed and is seeking American cover to save face.

 General Asim Munir & the Nobel Drama:
Pakistani media and sympathizers are now absurdly demanding a Nobel Peace Prize for General Asim Munir. ü§¶
.The irony: their airbases were destroyed in Operation Sindoor, and they are calling that ‚Äúpeace.‚Äù
. This exposes Pakistan‚Äôs desperation to maintain international credibility, even while the world has seen India‚Äôs satellite proof.

Pakistani Prime Minister‚Äôs Admission:
Pakistan‚Äôs Prime Minister himself admitted in speeches that their airbases were targeted.
. That‚Äôs an official acknowledgment from the highest political level, confirming India‚Äôs successful strike.

 Comparison of Facts:
. India: Evidence, satellite images, confirmed damage, minimal casualties.
.Pakistan: Contradictory statements, Nobel prize drama, thanking Trump, but zero evidence 
Operation Sindoor stands as India‚Äôs strategic, military, and diplomatic victory.
Pakistan‚Äôs defeat is so deep that it is exposing itself with contradictory statements and hollow propaganda. Once again, India has shown that when our sovereignty and security are challenged, we not only strike back but also expose the enemy before the world. üí™üáÆüá≥

text: thanks for the subtitles. I am from Sweden so it helped me. Pakistan not only shot down multiple Indian jets but also destroyed an S-400 system during its precision strikes. As an aviation enthusiast who followed the conflict closely, I was genuinely impressed by how professionally the PAF conducted its briefings, releasing cockpit audio, radar footage, wreckage, and exact coordinates ‚Äî while the IAF offered no proof and kept changing its claims daily from ‚Äúcapturing Islamabad‚Äù to ‚Äúdestroying Karachi‚Äù to destroyed 20 PAF jets. Kudos to the PAF for its Win, and here‚Äôs hoping both nations move towards lasting peace.

text:
Another exceptional video, covering every point from military action to diplomacy, and backed with proofs. Yet I will say you failed to defeat them in the narrative. But those who want to see will see, and those who don‚Äôt will never believe
Btw, you should have mentioned abt Serviceman RamBabu Kumar Singh from Bihar, who was working near the S 400 radar and command system before he d!ed in Pakistani strikes in which radar and command system was also destr0yed. After this, his father and a few relatives admitted it, but people in the comments began abusing them simply because the truth was breaking their narrative. Soon after, all related videos were taken down.

To control the damage and save face, within 2‚Äì3 days they changed the story: first claiming he was never deployed near the S-400 and was working in the army and died differently in operation sindoor, then later inventing a new tale that he d!ed in a road accident near Jammu airport. But if that were true, at least some local media in Jammu whom I know cover even the smallest incidents, would have reported it, yet not a single word was covered. This is the level of l!es they spread just to manufacture and win a narrative war.

Watching from J&K.
